subject: Re: [junit] Re: private test methods in TestCase class
msgSnippet: ... Do not weave aspects into your tests; only your production code (= the code you are testing). As for testing aspects, that is outside the scope of my
messageBody:
andrzejkrzywda wrote:

> Hi!
>
> >
> > Do you need to weave aspects into your test code, or just your
> > production code? If possible, I recommend weaving aspects /only/
> into
> > your production code. (This is a general recommendation and not just
> one
> > way to deal with your difficulty.)
>
> Could you explain this recommendation a bit further?
> In my design aspects represent some features, so each time I provide a
> feature to my base code I want to provide test cases for it to my test
> suits. It helps me keep features(components) pluggable.

Do not weave aspects into your tests; only your production code (= the
code you are testing).

As for testing aspects, that is outside the scope of my experience.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
